newsitem.title: CHINA: Haixin Shipping to get property insurance.
newsitem.headline: Haixin Shipping to get property insurance.

text.p: Beijing's state-owned People's Insurance Co of China plans to underwrite the Shanghai Haixin Shipping Co to the value of 1.4 billion yuan ($169 million) from July 1, the Business News said on Sunday.
The policy would cover 76 cargoes owned by Haixin, China's only shipping firm listed in Hong Kong, the newspaper said.
The insurance would provide a safety net for Haixin, which carries 80 percent of Shanghai and East China's energy and ore needs, it said.
It would also have a stabilising effect on H shares, Chinese companies listed on the Hong Kong exchange, it said.
The newspaper gave no details of the cost of the policy to Haixin.
Haixin, a subsidiary of Shanghai Maritime (Group) Co Ltd, has a fleet of more than 180 vessels with combined tonnage of 3.77 million dead-weight tonnes, the official media has said.
